my_mothod: The doc for the Java editor example claims that JavaDoc keywords and tags  should have a custom color. I tried the exampel and this wasn't the case. [misc] Example Java editor JavaDoc keywords not colored minor Text Platform

description: Driver: eclipse-SDK-3.1-win32 with eclipse-test-framework-3.1  Every we open and close an editor. That editor instance is being leaked. We  have a testcase that can demostrate the problem. The testcase is really simple.  It creates a new simple project and a new file. It opens up the new file in the  editor that comes with the testcase, then close the editor. Repeat 500 times.  What's interesting is that the editor, upon open, will allocate a 200000 size  String array as a private field. So this String array can be GC-ed if the  editor itself can be GC-ed.  If you run this testcase with -Xmx256M, you will run out of memory. However, if  you explicitly set the String array to null in the dispose() method of the  editor, then the same testcase will not run out of memory. This leads us to  believe that the editor instance is being leaked.
my_mothod: Driver: eclipse-SDK-3.1-win32 with eclipse-test-framework-3.1  Every we open and close an editor. That editor instance is being leaked. We  have a testcase that can demostrate the problem. The testcase is really simple.  It creates a new simple project and a new file. It opens up the new file in the  editor that comes with the testcase, then close the editor. Repeat 500 times.  What's interesting is that the editor, upon open, will allocate a 200000 size  String array as a private field. So this String array can be GC-ed if the  editor itself can be GC-ed.  If you run this testcase with -Xmx256M, you will run out of memory. However, if  you explicitly set the String array to null in the dispose() method of the  editor, then the same testcase will not run out of memory. This leads us to  believe that the editor instance is being leaked. [MPE] [EditorMgmt] An editor instance is being leaked each time an editor is open and closed critical UI Platform

description: When the EMF build attempts to use Ant to run its tests, one step in the process is to fire relengbuildgtk.sh (from org.eclipe.emf.releng.build). Running this script is fine, but midway through the script, an export statement is reached, which exports the environment variables LD_ASSUME_KERNEL and LD_LIBRARY_PATH, defined as:  LD_ASSUME_KERNEL=2.2.5 LD_LIBRARY_PATH=.  This worked fine on Debian/Stable (Woody), 32-bit, using kernel 2.4. Having upgraded our build box to Debian Sarge, 64-bit, with kernel 2.6, this no longer works.
my_mothod: When the EMF build attempts to use Ant to run its tests, one step in the process is to fire relengbuildgtk.sh (from org.eclipe.emf.releng.build). Running this script is fine, but midway through the script, an export statement is reached, which exports the environment variables LD_ASSUME_KERNEL and LD_LIBRARY_PATH, defined as:  LD_ASSUME_KERNEL=2.2.5 LD_LIBRARY_PATH=.  This worked fine on Debian/Stable (Woody), 32-bit, using kernel 2.4. Having upgraded our build box to Debian Sarge, 64-bit, with kernel 2.6, this no longer works. Ant fails to <exec> shell script commands (Debian kernel 2.6 / AMD64) critical Website EMF

description: The Java formatter already has "keep 'then' statement on same line" and "keep  simple 'if' on one line" options, which I like to use, but for some reason  there are no equivalent options for 'for' and 'while' statements.  Right now if I write a 'for' statement like this:  for(String s : myStrings) System.out.println(s);  ...the formatter changes it to this:  for(String s : myStrings)     System.out.println(s);  I don't like indentation like this for 'if's, so naturally I don't like it  for 'for's or 'while's either. In general, if the line is short enough, and I'm  pretty sure I won't need to add more lines inside the loop (or if/then block  for that matter), I prefer to keep it all on one line. If the line would be  longer than my set limit, then it would be nice if the formatter would  automatically insert the braces and put it in a block below the if/for/while,  thereby avoiding the indented line style above altogether.
my_mothod: The Java formatter already has "keep 'then' statement on same line" and "keep  simple 'if' on one line" options, which I like to use, but for some reason  there are no equivalent options for 'for' and 'while' statements.  Right now if I write a 'for' statement like this:  for(String s : myStrings) System.out.println(s);  ...the formatter changes it to this:  for(String s : myStrings)     System.out.println(s);  I don't like indentation like this for 'if's, so naturally I don't like it  for 'for's or 'while's either. In general, if the line is short enough, and I'm  pretty sure I won't need to add more lines inside the loop (or if/then block  for that matter), I prefer to keep it all on one line. If the line would be  longer than my set limit, then it would be nice if the formatter would  automatically insert the braces and put it in a block below the if/for/while,  thereby avoiding the indented line style above altogether. [formatter] add "keep simple for/while on one line" option enhancement Core JDT

See that the  generated import statement illegally contains a generic template.

description: I20051018-0800, GTK+ 2.6.8, KDE 3.4.1, X.org 6.8.2, Linux 2.6.13      + When I saw Bug 113454, I started up Eclipse and synchronized with HEAD.    Even with all the code from HEAD, no errors showed up in my Problems view.    + So, I opened the file referenced in the first compile error   (ResourceMappingMarkersTest), and it had several errors in it.   + I clicked on one of the methods that was an error   (problemView.getCurrentMarkers()), and hit "F3".  Now one error appears in the   Problems view: "ModelProvider cannot be resolved" in CompositeResourceMapping.   + I tried cleaning all projects, to see if that would motivate the errors to   appear.  The one error that was there previously then disappeared.     I had a hard time deciding whether to make this "blocker" or "major".  The big  problem, as I see it, is that this can lead to broken builds (as we've seen).   So I marked it as a blocker.
my_mothod: I20051018-0800, GTK+ 2.6.8, KDE 3.4.1, X.org 6.8.2, Linux 2.6.13      + When I saw Bug 113454, I started up Eclipse and synchronized with HEAD.    Even with all the code from HEAD, no errors showed up in my Problems view.    + So, I opened the file referenced in the first compile error   (ResourceMappingMarkersTest), and it had several errors in it.   + I clicked on one of the methods that was an error   (problemView.getCurrentMarkers()), and hit "F3".  Now one error appears in the   Problems view: "ModelProvider cannot be resolved" in CompositeResourceMapping.   + I tried cleaning all projects, to see if that would motivate the errors to   appear.  The one error that was there previously then disappeared.     I had a hard time deciding whether to make this "blocker" or "major".  The big  problem, as I see it, is that this can lead to broken builds (as we've seen).   So I marked it as a blocker. [Markers] Some error markers do not appear blocker UI Platform

description: When the document has the characters which can't be converted to the specified encoding and it is saved, no error is reported so that it gives the users that the save is ok. However, when the editor is closed and the same document is opened again, such characters are all changed to '?'. ( This is because java converter changes all such characters to '?' ). For example, if Window > Preferences >  Workbench > Editors > Text file encoding is set to US-ASCII, and the text file is opened by TextEditor and the non US-ASCII characters are entered ( all they are doable now ), and finally that file is saved, no error is reported. However, after that document is closed and is opened again, there are '?' characters.  This is a surpirse for the users so that it would be best if the save detected this kind of invalid character errors and reported this to the users. For example, OutputStreamWriter#write throws UnmappableCharacterException, so we can detect this kind of encoding errors.
my_mothod: When the document has the characters which can't be converted to the specified encoding and it is saved, no error is reported so that it gives the users that the save is ok. However, when the editor is closed and the same document is opened again, such characters are all changed to '?'. ( This is because java converter changes all such characters to '?' ). For example, if Window > Preferences >  Workbench > Editors > Text file encoding is set to US-ASCII, and the text file is opened by TextEditor and the non US-ASCII characters are entered ( all they are doable now ), and finally that file is saved, no error is reported. However, after that document is closed and is opened again, there are '?' characters.  This is a surpirse for the users so that it would be best if the save detected this kind of invalid character errors and reported this to the users. For example, OutputStreamWriter#write throws UnmappableCharacterException, so we can detect this kind of encoding errors. [typing] Need much smart encoding error detection for text save critical Text Platform

description: I'd like the formatter to insert line breaks to wrap the for loop setup (or whatever that part in parens that immediately follows the "for" keyword is called), for example, if I have this for loop:  for (Thing foo = really.long.initializer(); foo.conditionIsStillTrue(); foo.proceedToNextValue()) {   foo.doStuff();   ... }  I'd like the first line to get wrapped by the formatter, ideally like this:  for (Thing foo = really.long.initializer();      foo.conditionIsStillTrue();      foo.proceedToNextValue()) {   foo.doStuff();   ... }  Simultaneously, I'd like short things not to be wrapped, for example:  for (int i = 0; i < MAX; i++) {   ... }  I looked through the formatter options, but didn't see anything related to for loops.  I also looked through the bugs and on the web but didn't find any info.
my_mothod: I'd like the formatter to insert line breaks to wrap the for loop setup (or whatever that part in parens that immediately follows the "for" keyword is called), for example, if I have this for loop:  for (Thing foo = really.long.initializer(); foo.conditionIsStillTrue(); foo.proceedToNextValue()) {   foo.doStuff();   ... }  I'd like the first line to get wrapped by the formatter, ideally like this:  for (Thing foo = really.long.initializer();      foo.conditionIsStillTrue();      foo.proceedToNextValue()) {   foo.doStuff();   ... }  Simultaneously, I'd like short things not to be wrapped, for example:  for (int i = 0; i < MAX; i++) {   ... }  I looked through the formatter options, but didn't see anything related to for loops.  I also looked through the bugs and on the web but didn't find any info. [formatter] Enable wrapping of for loop setup enhancement Core JDT

description: Description: Press "ctrl+enter" key, two more lines were added in a label item.  Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a label. 2. Input "abc" then press "ctrl"+"enter" key. 3. Now there are three lines in the label. If I input some text, it becomes two lines.
my_mothod: Description: Press "ctrl+enter" key, two more lines were added in a label item.  Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a label. 2. Input "abc" then press "ctrl"+"enter" key. 3. Now there are three lines in the label. If I input some text, it becomes two lines. Press "ctrl+enter" key, two more lines were added in a label item. trivial Report Designer BIRT

description: Hi,  These lines of code have worked in Eclipse 3.2M3 but the coolbar is not shown until resizing the TopWindow in 3.2M4.  ----------------8<---------------- public class ApplicationActionBarAdvisor extends ActionBarAdvisor { // .... protected void fillCoolBar(ICoolBarManager coolBar) {   IToolBarManager toolbar = new ToolBarManager(SWT.FLAT | SWT.RIGHT);   coolBar.add(new ToolBarContributionItem(toolbar, "main"));   toolbar.add(ActionFactory.QUIT.create(window)); } } ----------------8<----------------
my_mothod: Hi,  These lines of code have worked in Eclipse 3.2M3 but the coolbar is not shown until resizing the TopWindow in 3.2M4.  ----------------8<---------------- public class ApplicationActionBarAdvisor extends ActionBarAdvisor { // .... protected void fillCoolBar(ICoolBarManager coolBar) {   IToolBarManager toolbar = new ToolBarManager(SWT.FLAT | SWT.RIGHT);   coolBar.add(new ToolBarContributionItem(toolbar, "main"));   toolbar.add(ActionFactory.QUIT.create(window)); } } ----------------8<---------------- [RCP] (regression) Coolbar only shown when MainWindow-Resized major UI Platform

description: Allow documentation content to be installed on one (central) machine, and accessed by multiple Eclipse Workbench clients (on other machines).   This requirement is based on the need for users to reduce the footprint of what's installed on their development machine; docs can get quite big. Also, documentation updates could be handled centrally, too.  Would need a preference indicating the location of the central docs. Local doc plugins would be ignored (this situation to be covered in another feature request) and so could be not installed.
my_mothod: Allow documentation content to be installed on one (central) machine, and accessed by multiple Eclipse Workbench clients (on other machines).   This requirement is based on the need for users to reduce the footprint of what's installed on their development machine; docs can get quite big. Also, documentation updates could be handled centrally, too.  Would need a preference indicating the location of the central docs. Local doc plugins would be ignored (this situation to be covered in another feature request) and so could be not installed. [Help] Remote help system enhancement User Assistance Platform

Additionally, a 404 Not Found error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.

description: There seems to be an undesired interference between "Delete Next Word" and hyperlink highlighting in rare circumstances (easy to reproduce, though):  Steps to reproduce:  1. Create a new Java class. 2. Move caret to the very end of file 3. Enter "// String", so that "g" is the last character of the file 4. Select the "r" in "String" 5. Now move the mouse pointer over the word while holding CTRL to activate    Java hyperlink highlighting 6. While still holding CTRL, press DEL  In addition to "r" being deleted, an error dialog pops up and the following exception is logged:  "Delete Next Word" did not complete normally. description: build I20060125  When the Properties view is active and is showing properties from a view that can save its changes (i.e. it implements ISaveablePart), the Save action does not work as expected.  Instead of saving the source of the properties, it targets the active editor (which may be completely unrelated to the Properties view or its source part).  In the worst case, this can lead to lost work due to unexpected overwriting of the editor's source file. This is a major usability issue in some Eclipse-based products.
my_mothod: build I20060125  When the Properties view is active and is showing properties from a view that can save its changes (i.e. it implements ISaveablePart), the Save action does not work as expected.  Instead of saving the source of the properties, it targets the active editor (which may be completely unrelated to the Properties view or its source part).  In the worst case, this can lead to lost work due to unexpected overwriting of the editor's source file. This is a major usability issue in some Eclipse-based products. [PropertiesView] Properties view should delegate Save back to source part major UI Platform

description: It would be nice if we could develop an administration tool for Planet Eclipse. The idea is to develop a web frontend which manages feed information (including  arbitrary attributes per feed like face=...) in a database. The second part is a script that is schedulded via a cron job. This scripts generates the planet configuration out of the database information.

The idea is to develop a web frontend which manages feed information (including  arbitrary attributes per feed like face=...) in a database. The second part is a script that is schedulded via a cron job. This scripts generates the planet configuration out of the database information. description: When Javadoc comments setting have both check-boxes "Indent Javadoc tags" and "Indent description after parm" checked, description is aligned on the tab boundary (plus one additional space) while parameter name is separated from the tag only with one space. Proposed patch aligns parameter name and description (in all tags) exactly on the tab boundary. This significantly improves readability of the comments. All updated files are in package org.eclipse.jdt.internal.formatter.comment. --- CommentRegion.java 2006-02-19 18:40:00.000000000 +0200 +++ CommentRegion.java.orig 2006-01-18 23:12:00.000000000 +0200 @@ -590,22 +590,4 @@ protected CommentLine createLine() { return new SingleCommentLine(this); } - - /** - * Convenience method to simplify derived classes access to TAB size information. - * - * @return current logical size of the TAB character. - */ - protected int getTabSize() { - return fTabSize; - } - - /** - * Convenience method to simplify derived classes access to TAB expansion state flag. - * - * @return true if TAB character should be used. - */ - protected boolean useTabs() { - return fUseTab; - } } --- MultiCommentLine.java 2006-02-19 17:39:00.000000000 +0200 +++ MultiCommentLine.java.orig 2006-01-18 23:11:00.000000000 +0200 @@ -99,15 +99,15 @@ if (parent.isIndentRoots()) { final CommentRange first= getFirst(); - final String common= parent.getText(first.getOffset(), first.getLength()); - - if (hasAttribute(COMMENT_ROOT) || hasAttribute(COMMENT_PARAMETER)) { - if (parent.isIndentDescriptions()) { - fReferenceIndentation = common + "\t"; //$NON-NLS-1$ - } - else { - fReferenceIndentation= common + CommentRegion.COMMENT_RANGE_DELIMITER; - } + final String common= parent.getText(first.getOffset(), first.getLength()) + CommentRegion.COMMENT_RANGE_DELIMITER; + + if (hasAttribute(COMMENT_ROOT)) + fReferenceIndentation= common; + else if (hasAttribute(COMMENT_PARAMETER)) { + if (parent.isIndentDescriptions()) + fReferenceIndentation= "\t" + common; //$NON-NLS-1$ + else + fReferenceIndentation= common; } } } --- MultiCommentRegion.java 2006-02-19 18:52:00.000000000 +0200 +++ MultiCommentRegion.java.orig 2006-01-18 23:11:00.000000000 +0200 @@ -151,23 +151,8 @@ // simply preserve range (~ word) breaks if (previous != null && !previous.hasAttribute(COMMENT_STARTS_WITH_RANGE_DELIMITER)) { return ""; //$NON-NLS-1$ - } else { - String delimiter = super.getDelimiter(previous, next); - - if (isIndentDescriptions() && next.hasAttribute(ICommentAttributes.COMMENT_FIRST_TOKEN) && - (next.hasAttribute(ICommentAttributes.COMMENT_ROOT) || next.hasAttribute(ICommentAttributes.COMMENT_PARAMETER))) { - if (!useTabs()) - { - int len = getTabSize() - (next.getLength() % getTabSize()); - delimiter = ""; - - while(len-- > 0) - delimiter += " "; - } - else - delimiter = "\t"; - } - return delimiter; + } else { + return super.getDelimiter(previous, next); } }

description: PasteIntoParentOperation#resolveReferences( ) iterates over the children and calls PasteIntoParentOperation#rcheckReferences(child) on each of them. It then does child.eClass.getEAllReferences( ) and resets them unless they are containment references or not changeable. However, it does not check if the reference is "opposite", and if the other end is maybe a containment reference.  In my case I am pasting Enumeration with EnumerationLiterals (Eclipse's UML2 project). In case of theEnumerationLiteral there is the "enumeration" reference which is obviously not containment and is changable so GMF resets it. That modifies the iterator on fly causing the index out of bounds exception since the iterator is now index based. It would throw ConcurentAccessModification exception with a regular iterator.  I think GMF needs to also check if the reference is "opposite", and if it is if the other end is maybe a containment reference. In my example it'd be "ownedLiteral", which is containment reference.
my_mothod: PasteIntoParentOperation#resolveReferences( ) iterates over the children and calls PasteIntoParentOperation#rcheckReferences(child) on each of them. It then does child.eClass.getEAllReferences( ) and resets them unless they are containment references or not changeable. However, it does not check if the reference is "opposite", and if the other end is maybe a containment reference.  In my case I am pasting Enumeration with EnumerationLiterals (Eclipse's UML2 project). In case of theEnumerationLiteral there is the "enumeration" reference which is obviously not containment and is changable so GMF resets it. That modifies the iterator on fly causing the index out of bounds exception since the iterator is now index based. It would throw ConcurentAccessModification exception with a regular iterator.  I think GMF needs to also check if the reference is "opposite", and if it is if the other end is maybe a containment reference. In my example it'd be "ownedLiteral", which is containment reference. Exceptions in paste operation blocker General GMF-Runtime

description: The Edit Template dialog box is a textbook example of bad options. It says:  "The name of the template has been changed. Click 'Yes' to create an additional template with the new name or 'No' to rename the existing one." Options: Yes/No  If 2/3 of the description is explanations what the options are supposed to be it's quite obvious that the options are bad. I suggest relabeling 'Yes' -> 'Create new' and 'No' -> 'Rename existing'.  This is one of the first dialogs I've seen in Eclipse, so I suppose there are a lot more like this. In general it's better to avoid Yes/No options, because they almost always require the user to spend unnecessarily much time and effort in understanding the exact wording of the question. Instead the action should be more or less obvious based on the options. (E.g. instead of "Do you want to quit without saving? Options: Yes/No" or "Do you want to save before you quit? Options: Yes/No" you should always prefer something like "There are modifications. Options: Save and quit/Discard and quit".)
my_mothod: The Edit Template dialog box is a textbook example of bad options. It says:  "The name of the template has been changed. I suggest relabeling 'Yes' -> 'Create new' and 'No' -> 'Rename existing'.  This is one of the first dialogs I've seen in Eclipse, so I suppose there are a lot more like this. In general it's better to avoid Yes/No options, because they almost always require the user to spend unnecessarily much time and effort in understanding the exact wording of the question. Instead the action should be more or less obvious based on the options. (E.g. instead of "Do you want to quit without saving? Options: Yes/No" or "Do you want to save before you quit? Options: Yes/No" you should always prefer something like "There are modifications. Options: Save and quit/Discard and quit".) [preferences] Edit Template: Rename Yes/No buttons and dialog text minor Text Platform

description: There is no easy way to retrieve the current selection value from a RadioGroupFieldEditor.  (package org.eclipse.jface.preference)  Several other field editors provide methods to retrieve their current values.  Examples are: getBooleanValue(), getIntValue(), getStringValue(), getColorSelectorValue().getColorValue() and changePressed().    Please consider adding the following simple method (with a name change if appropriate) to the RadioGroupFieldEditor class:       public String getSelectionValue() { return value; }   Allowing the retrievial of the current value for the remaining field editor types (directory, file, font, list, path and scale) might also be considered.   ------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Background:   In my case, a radio selection is used to dynamically alter the preference names used by other field editors (e.g. a syntax element selected via radio button and related style attributes).  A change to the radio buttons must be acted on immediately to reload the other field values using different preference names.    Ideally, allowing multiple property change listeners in the FieldEditor Class would eliminate the problem since the current value could be passed to a user provided listener.  Bug 70500 (July 2004, P4, NEW) requested this, but it is currently unresolved.   Because of the restriction on listeners, every change must be checked via a PropertyChange() extension.  There is apparently no way to determine which field editor was changed, and thus the inability to retrieve the current radio button value to determine if it has changed makes things more difficult.  Creating a new field editor which is an exact copy of RadioGroupFieldEditor with the suggested change is one way, and using a kludge including "isinstanceof String" while restricting the types of editors on the page is another.  Using only the new value given to PropertyChange() is unreliable, since it could contain a user supplied string.            If the resolution of bug 70500 is a long way off, providing a way to retrieve the current value of a radio button field editor will certainly be useful in this case as well as for other cases discussed in the newsgroups.
my_mothod: There is no easy way to retrieve the current selection value from a RadioGroupFieldEditor.  (package org.eclipse.jface.preference)  Several other field editors provide methods to retrieve their current values.  Examples are: getBooleanValue(), getIntValue(), getStringValue(), getColorSelectorValue().getColorValue() and changePressed().    Please consider adding the following simple method (with a name change if appropriate) to the RadioGroupFieldEditor class:       public String getSelectionValue() { return value; }   Allowing the retrievial of the current value for the remaining field editor types (directory, file, font, list, path and scale) might also be considered.   ------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Background:   In my case, a radio selection is used to dynamically alter the preference names used by other field editors (e.g. a syntax element selected via radio button and related style attributes).  A change to the radio buttons must be acted on immediately to reload the other field values using different preference names.    Ideally, allowing multiple property change listeners in the FieldEditor Class would eliminate the problem since the current value could be passed to a user provided listener.  Bug 70500 (July 2004, P4, NEW) requested this, but it is currently unresolved.   Because of the restriction on listeners, every change must be checked via a PropertyChange() extension.  There is apparently no way to determine which field editor was changed, and thus the inability to retrieve the current radio button value to determine if it has changed makes things more difficult.  Creating a new field editor which is an exact copy of RadioGroupFieldEditor with the suggested change is one way, and using a kludge including "isinstanceof String" while restricting the types of editors on the page is another.  Using only the new value given to PropertyChange() is unreliable, since it could contain a user supplied string.            If the resolution of bug 70500 is a long way off, providing a way to retrieve the current value of a radio button field editor will certainly be useful in this case as well as for other cases discussed in the newsgroups. [JFace] Radio Group Field Editor - no way to retrieve selection value enhancement UI Platform

description: Need to create a example zipper plugin for ocl, validation,query and transaction that zips up the examples and gets built with the sdk. description: Using M5 ; I've Created a diagram that contains 30 shapes and around 30 connections (each connection had 2 labels), select all then hit delete it took a minute for a delete operation to finish (although i'm just deleting form diagram)  Used the profiler to find what are the hot spots and it pointer out that          ReadWriteValidatorImpl$TransactionTree.find consumes 97% of the delete operation and the invocation count was too high ( 55 M calls )

description: I can create a SELECT statement object because the SELECT class is not in an internal package.  However, if I attempt to execute it, I get a warning from the JDT compiler telling me that access to the QueryStatement.execute() method is discouraged, because QueryStatement is in an internal package.  Either QueryStatement must not be internal, or SELECT must redefine all of the public methods of the QueryStatement class to just call super().  I am indicating a major severity because it is not possible to use this API in an environment that enforces internal access violations.
my_mothod: I can create a SELECT statement object because the SELECT class is not in an internal package.  However, if I attempt to execute it, I get a warning from the JDT compiler telling me that access to the QueryStatement.execute() method is discouraged, because QueryStatement is in an internal package.  Either QueryStatement must not be internal, or SELECT must redefine all of the public methods of the QueryStatement class to just call super().  I am indicating a major severity because it is not possible to use this API in an environment that enforces internal access violations. Cannot legally execute SELECT statements major Query EMF Services

description: It can happen that, during the doExecute() method of an AbstractEMFOperation, some Error or RuntimeException occurs in a (possibly deeply) nested transaction context.  This exception unwinds the Java call stack to the point where the finally block of the AbstractEMFOperation.execute() method attempts to roll back the transaction that it started because it was not committed.  However, at this point, that transaction is not active because some descendent still is.  The AbstractEMFOperation should rollback all open transactions from the bottom of the stack up to its own.  Failing to do so results in an IllegalStateException which masks whatever exception was originally being thrown, and results in a corrupted editing domain (regardless of whether the application could have recovered from the original exception).
my_mothod: It can happen that, during the doExecute() method of an AbstractEMFOperation, some Error or RuntimeException occurs in a (possibly deeply) nested transaction context.  This exception unwinds the Java call stack to the point where the finally block of the AbstractEMFOperation.execute() method attempts to roll back the transaction that it started because it was not committed.  However, at this point, that transaction is not active because some descendent still is.  The AbstractEMFOperation should rollback all open transactions from the bottom of the stack up to its own.  Failing to do so results in an IllegalStateException which masks whatever exception was originally being thrown, and results in a corrupted editing domain (regardless of whether the application could have recovered from the original exception). AbstractEMFOperation Closes Wrong Transaction on Exceptions major Transaction EMF Services

description: Currently, all constraintProviders, constraintBindings, etc. contributions are kept in a static registry, once initialized.  This can cause problems, for instance in GMF project unit-tests which generate source code of plugins with emf.validation extensions that need to be verified. Any generated plugin loaded after the emf.validation bundle start(BundleContext context) method is called, does not get registered with the validation framework.  A great improvement would be if emf.validation plugin makes use of extension addition/removal tracking mechanism provided by the platform and supports dynamic-awareness (http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/FAQ_What_is_a_dynamic_plug-in%3F).
my_mothod: Currently, all constraintProviders, constraintBindings, etc. contributions are kept in a static registry, once initialized.  This can cause problems, for instance in GMF project unit-tests which generate source code of plugins with emf.validation extensions that need to be verified. Any generated plugin loaded after the emf.validation bundle start(BundleContext context) method is called, does not get registered with the validation framework.  A great improvement would be if emf.validation plugin makes use of extension addition/removal tracking mechanism provided by the platform and supports dynamic-awareness (http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/FAQ_What_is_a_dynamic_plug-in%3F). Make 'org.eclipse.emf.validation' plugin dynamic-aware enhancement Validation EMF Services

description: To properly handle screen readers for users with visual impairments every icon that indicates some state must have a text equivalent somewhere in the UI. The validation preference page places little lock icons on constraint categories and constraints that are mandatory. This needs to be reflected somehow in the text description field at the bottom of the preference page whenever the user clicks on an item with the little lock icon on it.
my_mothod: To properly handle screen readers for users with visual impairments every icon that indicates some state must have a text equivalent somewhere in the UI. The validation preference page places little lock icons on constraint categories and constraints that are mandatory. This needs to be reflected somehow in the text description field at the bottom of the preference page whenever the user clicks on an item with the little lock icon on it. The validation preference page has no text-cue for mandatory constraints major Validation EMF Services

description: The live validation error dialog (this is the default setting) will come up and completely stall a JUnit run. There is a way to check to see if automated JUnits are being run by checking the ErrorDialog.AUTOMATED_MODE flag set in the org.eclipse.jface.dialogs. This flag is set by the eclipse automated JUnit system to prevent all sorts of error dialogs from coming up and locking up automated JUnits.
my_mothod: The live validation error dialog (this is the default setting) will come up and completely stall a JUnit run. There is a way to check to see if automated JUnits are being run by checking the ErrorDialog.AUTOMATED_MODE flag set in the org.eclipse.jface.dialogs. This flag is set by the eclipse automated JUnit system to prevent all sorts of error dialogs from coming up and locking up automated JUnits. Validation UI should not bring up a live validation error dialog if it is being invoked as part of automated JUnits major Validation EMF Services

description: Some client code that needs to access the Model is not fully aware of its context, and therefore, clients are forced to start a new Transaction to conform to the protocol. The point is, client code could be invoked from within an already open Transaction and thus it doesn't really need to open a new one. Currently, there is no way for clients to know that a new Transaction is not really needed, and Tarnsaction farmework does not try to re-use/coalesce nested Transactions running in the very same Thread. This resulted in hundereds of temporary short-lived Transactions being created unnecessarily and thus caused some performance degradation.
my_mothod: Some client code that needs to access the Model is not fully aware of its context, and therefore, clients are forced to start a new Transaction to conform to the protocol. The point is, client code could be invoked from within an already open Transaction and thus it doesn't really need to open a new one. Currently, there is no way for clients to know that a new Transaction is not really needed, and Tarnsaction farmework does not try to re-use/coalesce nested Transactions running in the very same Thread. This resulted in hundereds of temporary short-lived Transactions being created unnecessarily and thus caused some performance degradation. Performance: Clients need a way to piggyback on already open Transaction major Transaction EMF Services

description: Running the ant debugger in the same VM seems to cause a memory leak. In a new plugin project, I generated a build file with the PDE tools ran that build file a bunch of times and eventually ran out of memory.  A little profiling shows that DebugTarget's aren't being collected properly. Will look into this some more and report back in the morning.
my_mothod: Running the ant debugger in the same VM seems to cause a memory leak. In a new plugin project, I generated a build file with the PDE tools ran that build file a bunch of times and eventually ran out of memory.  A little profiling shows that DebugTarget's aren't being collected properly. Will look into this some more and report back in the morning. Memory Leak in debugger critical Debug Platform

description: 1. Start a new instance of Eclipse (you won't be able to exit    cleanly from this scenario so don't have any unsaved work) 2. In a plugin project, add a new *.product file    (File->New->Other->Plugin Dev->Product Configuration) 3. In the wizard, name the file foo.product, and select to create    a file with basic settings (first radio button). Finish. 4. In the editor, type something in the "Product Name" box, just    to make the file dirty. 5. Without saving, select the file in the package explorer, then    press "Delete" (or right-click->Delete) 6. Eclipse politely asks "Are you sure you want to delete...?". Of    course you are, so click "Yes". 7. It does something, then asks:        '...' has been modified. Save changes?    No, we don't want to save changes. Click "No".  Result: Eclipse is hanging so badly it has to be shot down using an Anti Eclipse Missile (AEM, aka kill -9).  Actually, while writing this report I noticed the hang occurs even before you answer the last dialog.
my_mothod: 1. Start a new instance of Eclipse (you won't be able to exit    cleanly from this scenario so don't have any unsaved work) 2. In a plugin project, add a new *.product file    (File->New->Other->Plugin Dev->Product Configuration) 3. In the wizard, name the file foo.product, and select to create    a file with basic settings (first radio button). Finish. 4. In the editor, type something in the "Product Name" box, just    to make the file dirty. 5. Without saving, select the file in the package explorer, then    press "Delete" (or right-click->Delete) 6. Eclipse politely asks "Are you sure you want to delete...?". Of    course you are, so click "Yes". 7. It does something, then asks:        '...' has been modified. Save changes?    No, we don't want to save changes. Click "No".  Result: Eclipse is hanging so badly it has to be shot down using an Anti Eclipse Missile (AEM, aka kill -9).  Actually, while writing this report I noticed the hang occurs even before you answer the last dialog. Eclipse hangs when deleting a "dirty" product file from a project critical UI Platform

description: RC6  Seems to be a regression since RC4.  - create a new Java file with content below - in the Java editor use 'Ctrl + .' and 'Ctrl + ,' (Next / Previous) to toggle through the 2 errors in the file - select 'args', Invoke 'Search > Occurrences In File > Indentifier' - set focus to the search view (3 matches) and try to use 'Ctrl + .' 'Ctrl + ,' to go through the search results. -> does nothing in the search view but still toggles highlighting in the editor - same problem with the prev / next toolbar buttons of the search view Using the global menu actions, this works.   I verified that this bug was not yet in RC4 (I20060512-1600)   ----- A.java  package pack;  import java.util.List; import java.util.List2;  public class A implements List { 	/** 	 * @param args 	 */ 	public static void main(String[] args) { 		System.out.println(args[0]); 	}  }
my_mothod: RC6  Seems to be a regression since RC4.  - create a new Java file with content below - in the Java editor use 'Ctrl + .' and 'Ctrl + ,' (Next / Previous) to toggle through the 2 errors in the file - select 'args', Invoke 'Search > Occurrences In File > Indentifier' - set focus to the search view (3 matches) and try to use 'Ctrl + .' 'Ctrl + ,' to go through the search results. -> does nothing in the search view but still toggles highlighting in the editor - same problem with the prev / next toolbar buttons of the search view Using the global menu actions, this works.   I verified that this bug was not yet in RC4 (I20060512-1600)   ----- A.java  package pack;  import java.util.List; import java.util.List2;  public class A implements List { 	/** 	 * @param args 	 */ 	public static void main(String[] args) { 		System.out.println(args[0]); 	}  } next / prev not working anymore in search view blocker UI Platform

description: I would like to import several existing projects via Import->Existing Projects into Workspace. Unfortunately, only projects that are in the root directory itself or in the immediate subfolder below are imported.   My source structure is as follows: TOP/   src1/     prj1     prj2   src2/     prj3  If I select TOP as the root directory the Import Wizard does not show any projects. I have to use the Import Wizard for every subfolder (here, src1 and src2).

description: If you have a tag context like:  <f:someTag attr="blah"/>  and you pass the context of attr to TaglibContextResolver methods that handle attributes, the resolver does not validate to ensure that the tld corresponding to 'f'  actually defines an attribute called 'attr'.  C.B: in my opinion this is the JSP editor's job and not ours.  If, for usability reasons, we find it critical to solve it ourselves, then a separate method on the Tablib resolver should be defined called "isValidAttribute" should be added.  Ideally, we should push the validation of all generic tag lib issues down to the  JSP layer where it belongs.
my_mothod: If you have a tag context like:  <f:someTag attr="blah"/>  and you pass the context of attr to TaglibContextResolver methods that handle attributes, the resolver does not validate to ensure that the tld corresponding to 'f'  actually defines an attribute called 'attr'.  C.B: in my opinion this is the JSP editor's job and not ours.  If, for usability reasons, we find it critical to solve it ourselves, then a separate method on the Tablib resolver should be defined called "isValidAttribute" should be added.  Ideally, we should push the validation of all generic tag lib issues down to the  JSP layer where it belongs. TaglibContextResolver does not validate attributes minor Core Java Server Faces

description: Resource-level events are batched like any other, and therefore will not be sent to post-commit listeners in the event of a transaction rollback, where these changes occur in a transaction context (they are not required to be done in a transaction).  However, these resource changes are not undoable, so rollback cannot undo them, and the events must still be propagated to clients.  Otherwise, these clients will never find out that:    - a resource has been loaded (isLoaded property)   - a resource has been unloaded (isLoaded property)   - a resource has been saved (isModified property)   - a resource URI has been changed, e.g. by "save as" (URI property)  These are critical events that applications must not miss.  Either resource- and resource-set-level events should be forwarded immediately to clients (not batched) or they should be sent even after a roll-back, excluding of course all object-level events.
my_mothod: Resource-level events are batched like any other, and therefore will not be sent to post-commit listeners in the event of a transaction rollback, where these changes occur in a transaction context (they are not required to be done in a transaction).  However, these resource changes are not undoable, so rollback cannot undo them, and the events must still be propagated to clients.  Otherwise, these clients will never find out that:    - a resource has been loaded (isLoaded property)   - a resource has been unloaded (isLoaded property)   - a resource has been saved (isModified property)   - a resource URI has been changed, e.g. by "save as" (URI property)  These are critical events that applications must not miss.  Either resource- and resource-set-level events should be forwarded immediately to clients (not batched) or they should be sent even after a roll-back, excluding of course all object-level events. Resource load/unload events lost when transaction rolls back major Transaction EMF Services

description: When creating a chart in BIRT 2.1RC4 (Designer All-In-One install), I discovered that the values returned are not correct with a sum grouping by date (month exactly).  With a dataset upon the ClassicModels sample DB, please make the following : - create a table (2 cols, 1 detail):   first row -> Orders.OrderDate   group the Orders.OrderDate by month (interval = 1)    second row -> Total.sum(OrderDetails.QuantityOrdered), aggregate on Orders.OrderDate  - create a bar chart :   category series -> Orders.OrderDate   Y axis values -> OrderDetails.QuantityOrdered    format the chart -> X axis : sum grouping by date (month) with an 1-interval  You'll see that the values returned by the table and the chart are not equal.  The attached file is a good example of this bug.  Thanks.
my_mothod: When creating a chart in BIRT 2.1RC4 (Designer All-In-One install), I discovered that the values returned are not correct with a sum grouping by date (month exactly).  With a dataset upon the ClassicModels sample DB, please make the following : - create a table (2 cols, 1 detail):   first row -> Orders.OrderDate   group the Orders.OrderDate by month (interval = 1)    second row -> Total.sum(OrderDetails.QuantityOrdered), aggregate on Orders.OrderDate  - create a bar chart :   category series -> Orders.OrderDate   Y axis values -> OrderDetails.QuantityOrdered    format the chart -> X axis : sum grouping by date (month) with an 1-interval  You'll see that the values returned by the table and the chart are not equal.  The attached file is a good example of this bug.  Thanks. Datetime grouping leads to inconsistent values in Chart engine 2.1RC4 critical Chart BIRT

description: This request is to provide a mechanism to allow trigger commands to rollback during execution.  If a trigger commands returns true for canExecute, but during execution an internal exeception occurs and the trigger command wishes to rollback the current operation, there is currently no way to accomplish this.
my_mothod: This request is to provide a mechanism to allow trigger commands to rollback during execution.  If a trigger commands returns true for canExecute, but during execution an internal exeception occurs and the trigger command wishes to rollback the current operation, there is currently no way to accomplish this. Provide a mechanism to allow trigger commands to rollback during execution major Transaction EMF Services

The "Next" and "Finish" buttons are disabled in the wizard, but no error message is displayed.  Only when clicking into the "connection name" field and changing the name there, the error message is displayed. When switching focus back to the host name field, the error message is no more displayed. New Connection Wizard: No error displayed when connection name already exists minor RSE Target Management

description: The post-commit phase of deactivation can throw run-time exceptions.  Although these are generally caused by programming errors and are unrecoverable, it is a fact of life that they will occur and be logged by the Eclipse platform.  When they do occur in post-commit, the TransactionalEditingDomainImpl.deactivate() method does not release the transaction's lock because this is not protected by a finally clause.  This will cause the lock to "dangle", owned forever by the last thread that had a transaction, and no other thread will ever be able to start a transaction for the duration of the Eclipse session.
my_mothod: The post-commit phase of deactivation can throw run-time exceptions.  Although these are generally caused by programming errors and are unrecoverable, it is a fact of life that they will occur and be logged by the Eclipse platform.  When they do occur in post-commit, the TransactionalEditingDomainImpl.deactivate() method does not release the transaction's lock because this is not protected by a finally clause.  This will cause the lock to "dangle", owned forever by the last thread that had a transaction, and no other thread will ever be able to start a transaction for the duration of the Eclipse session. TransactionalEditingDomainImpl.deactivate() does not release lock exceptions occur major Transaction EMF Services

description: With one transaction opened, create many transactions inside this transaction. Profile this scenario, and notice the intermediate memory held by the transaction infrastructure.   1. Transaction Infrastructure (ReadWriteValidatorImpl) keeps a map of transaction to its transaction tree. The entries of this map are not cleared when the child transaction is complete. Thereby the size of the map only grows when the transaction is running. 2. For every transaction, the infrastructure creates a TransactionTree. This also  adds a lot of memory consumption and needs to be optimized.
my_mothod: With one transaction opened, create many transactions inside this transaction. Profile this scenario, and notice the intermediate memory held by the transaction infrastructure.   1. Transaction Infrastructure (ReadWriteValidatorImpl) keeps a map of transaction to its transaction tree. The entries of this map are not cleared when the child transaction is complete. Thereby the size of the map only grows when the transaction is running. 2. For every transaction, the infrastructure creates a TransactionTree. This also  adds a lot of memory consumption and needs to be optimized. EMF Transaction Infrastructure doesn't scale well for large number of small transactions in one transaction major Transaction EMF Services

description: * ref-preferences-template-variables.htm: - Typo: Gener[i]al Template Variables - Example for "${id:arg(reference, n)}" wrong: is: "${type:arg(vector)}", expected: "${type:arg(vector, 0)}" - Java-Specific Template Variables: I would add something like: "Note: id is a user-chosen name of a new variable." - I think the Java-Specific Template Variables section would be easier to understand if the predefined simple variables would be shown below their expanded general form where applicable. This could also "teach by example", e.g.: ${id:var(type name)} - ${array} is short for ${array:var(java.lang.Object[])} ... ${id:elem(reference)} - ${array_element} is short for ${array_element:elem(array)} ... - Difference between General and Java-Specific Template Variables sections is unclear to me: E.g. ${enclosing_package} in General looks rather Java-specific. * ref-preferences-template-variables.htm and ref-preferences-edit-template-dialog.htm are not in the TOC (thus the Refresh/Show Current Topic button does not work)
my_mothod: * ref-preferences-template-variables.htm: - Typo: Gener[i]al Template Variables - Example for "${id:arg(reference, n)}" wrong: is: "${type:arg(vector)}", expected: "${type:arg(vector, 0)}" - Java-Specific Template Variables: I would add something like: "Note: id is a user-chosen name of a new variable." - I think the Java-Specific Template Variables section would be easier to understand if the predefined simple variables would be shown below their expanded general form where applicable. This could also "teach by example", e.g.: ${id:var(type name)} - ${array} is short for ${array:var(java.lang.Object[])} ... ${id:elem(reference)} - ${array_element} is short for ${array_element:elem(array)} ... - Difference between General and Java-Specific Template Variables sections is unclear to me: E.g. ${enclosing_package} in General looks rather Java-specific. * ref-preferences-template-variables.htm and ref-preferences-edit-template-dialog.htm are not in the TOC (thus the Refresh/Show Current Topic button does not work) Bugs in templates doc trivial Text JDT

description: If two or more trigger commands are returned by one TriggerListener that is being called on the trigger() method and the first command is a regular EMF command while the other is a ConditionalRedoCommand, the two are chained together as a regular EMF compound command. This causes the conditional redoableness of the second command to be lost.  In fact, a slight alteration to the transaction UndoRedoTest.test_nonredoableTriggerCommand_138287() JUnit test case reveals this problem. All that one needs to do is to somehow cause two notifications to be fired to the listener and the test case fails. One way to workaround the problem would be to fix the chain() method on the TestCommand.Redoable class to return a compound conditionally redoable command. This just fixes the test case and not the underlying problem.  The fact remains that a client could return heterogeneous commands from the call to their trigger() method and run into problems with conditional redoableness.
my_mothod: If two or more trigger commands are returned by one TriggerListener that is being called on the trigger() method and the first command is a regular EMF command while the other is a ConditionalRedoCommand, the two are chained together as a regular EMF compound command. This causes the conditional redoableness of the second command to be lost.  In fact, a slight alteration to the transaction UndoRedoTest.test_nonredoableTriggerCommand_138287() JUnit test case reveals this problem. All that one needs to do is to somehow cause two notifications to be fired to the listener and the test case fails. One way to workaround the problem would be to fix the chain() method on the TestCommand.Redoable class to return a compound conditionally redoable command. This just fixes the test case and not the underlying problem.  The fact remains that a client could return heterogeneous commands from the call to their trigger() method and run into problems with conditional redoableness. Commands are composed incorrectly in the TriggerListener class major Transaction EMF Services

description: In my application, I'm running in a ModalContext and updating my EMF model. I'm adding two elements to my model that are the same type, have the same name and are in the same location. This causes a dialog to open that is invoked by the live validation as seen in the following stack trace:  Object.wait(long, int) line: not available [native method]	 Semaphore(Object).wait(long) line: 231	 Semaphore.acquire(long) line: 43	 UISynchronizer.syncExec(Runnable) line: 46	 Display.syncExec(Runnable) line: 3763	 LiveValidationListener.showLiveValidationDialog(ValidationEvent) line: 176 LiveValidationListener.showProblemMessages(ValidationEvent) line: 162	 LiveValidationListener.validationOccurred(ValidationEvent) line: 90	 ModelValidationService.broadcastValidationEvent(ValidationEvent) line: 223 LiveValidator(AbstractValidator).validate(Collection) line: 154	 ReadWriteValidatorImpl.validate(Transaction) line: 220	 	 The dialog is opened using a syncExec call. Another thread in my application is also doing a syncExec. Although the runnable displaying the validation dialog completes, it never comes back from the syncExec and my application encounters deadlock.  If the live validation dialog used an asyncExec instead of a syncExec this issue would not occur.
my_mothod: In my application, I'm running in a ModalContext and updating my EMF model. I'm adding two elements to my model that are the same type, have the same name and are in the same location. This causes a dialog to open that is invoked by the live validation as seen in the following stack trace:  Object.wait(long, int) line: not available [native method]	 Semaphore(Object).wait(long) line: 231	 Semaphore.acquire(long) line: 43	 UISynchronizer.syncExec(Runnable) line: 46	 Display.syncExec(Runnable) line: 3763	 LiveValidationListener.showLiveValidationDialog(ValidationEvent) line: 176 LiveValidationListener.showProblemMessages(ValidationEvent) line: 162	 LiveValidationListener.validationOccurred(ValidationEvent) line: 90	 ModelValidationService.broadcastValidationEvent(ValidationEvent) line: 223 LiveValidator(AbstractValidator).validate(Collection) line: 154	 ReadWriteValidatorImpl.validate(Transaction) line: 220	 	 The dialog is opened using a syncExec call. Another thread in my application is also doing a syncExec. Although the runnable displaying the validation dialog completes, it never comes back from the syncExec and my application encounters deadlock.  If the live validation dialog used an asyncExec instead of a syncExec this issue would not occur. LiveValidationListener causes Deadlock major Validation EMF Services

description: I20060921-0010  Here are some points I found a bit confusing in the extension point description for org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor.rulerColumns. I think they should be added to the rulerColumns schema.  1) "id - The unique id of the column. The id should be in the namespace of the contributing plug-in." => Should the id be fully qualified now, or does "in the namespace" mean that it only has to be unique in the contributing plugin.xml? I'd prefer one of: a) "The id should be unique in the namespace...", or b) "The id should be qualified with the namespace...".   2) API Information: "... Editors that want to support the extension point should provide an adapter for IColumnSupport. Subclasses of AbstractDecoratedTextEditor support the extension point."  => AbstractTextEditor already adapts to IColumnSupport. Subclasses of AbstractTextEditor should only override createColumnSupport(..) with the suggested implementation, rather than providing the adapter again.   3) rulerColumns can only be shown when the vertical ruler is a CompositeRuler.  => Subclasses of AbstractDecoratedTextEditor use a CompositeRuler. Subclasses of AbstractTextEditor should override createVerticalRuler().
my_mothod: I20060921-0010  Here are some points I found a bit confusing in the extension point description for org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor.rulerColumns. I think they should be added to the rulerColumns schema.  1) "id - The unique id of the column. The id should be in the namespace of the contributing plug-in." => Should the id be fully qualified now, or does "in the namespace" mean that it only has to be unique in the contributing plugin.xml? I'd prefer one of: a) "The id should be unique in the namespace...", or b) "The id should be qualified with the namespace...".   2) API Information: "... Editors that want to support the extension point should provide an adapter for IColumnSupport. Subclasses of AbstractDecoratedTextEditor support the extension point."  => AbstractTextEditor already adapts to IColumnSupport. Subclasses of AbstractTextEditor should only override createColumnSupport(..) with the suggested implementation, rather than providing the adapter again.   3) rulerColumns can only be shown when the vertical ruler is a CompositeRuler.  => Subclasses of AbstractDecoratedTextEditor use a CompositeRuler. Subclasses of AbstractTextEditor should override createVerticalRuler(). [misc] Enhancements for the rulerColumns extension point description trivial Text Platform

description: Mylar catches all Throwables in several places ('grep -r Throwable * | grep -v "src-old"' returns 80 lines). I think, most of these should be changed to "catch (Exception e)" otherwise, Mylar catches too much.  An example: org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.TaskListManager, line 621: } catch (Throwable t) {     MylarStatusHandler.fail(t, "could not activate task", false); }   Consider the situation that some third party code uses EasyMock. EasyMock will throw AssertionErrors if unexpected things happen. If this exception is thrown in a module X invoked by Mylar because X is registered as a listener, Mylar will catch these errors. Unfortunately the caller won't notice that if he runs a JUnit test suite as the error log of the JUnit runtime instance is not available. In this situation Mylars masks unit test errors.  Can you please check, if you really need catching Throwable and consider a switch to Exception otherwise?
my_mothod: Mylar catches all Throwables in several places ('grep -r Throwable * | grep -v "src-old"' returns 80 lines). I think, most of these should be changed to "catch (Exception e)" otherwise, Mylar catches too much.  An example: org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.TaskListManager, line 621: } catch (Throwable t) {     MylarStatusHandler.fail(t, "could not activate task", false); }   Consider the situation that some third party code uses EasyMock. EasyMock will throw AssertionErrors if unexpected things happen. If this exception is thrown in a module X invoked by Mylar because X is registered as a listener, Mylar will catch these errors. Unfortunately the caller won't notice that if he runs a JUnit test suite as the error log of the JUnit runtime instance is not available. In this situation Mylars masks unit test errors.  Can you please check, if you really need catching Throwable and consider a switch to Exception otherwise? replace catch Throwable with SafeRunner trivial Tasks Mylyn

description: I like my + operator to have no spaces around it.  I like my && operator to have spaces around it.  Eclipse's formatter does not support this notion.  E.g.,  int a=b+c; return b==6 && a==5;  I can choose between these two formats for this code:  1. No spaces.  int a=b+c; return b==6&&a==5; //I find the && hard to see.  2. Lots of spaces.  int a = b + c; return b == 6 && a == 5;  I find it hard to ignore the extra whitespace; it takes me longer to read it.
my_mothod: I like my + operator to have no spaces around it.  I like my && operator to have spaces around it.  Eclipse's formatter does not support this notion.  E.g.,  int a=b+c; return b==6 && a==5;  I can choose between these two formats for this code:  1. No spaces.  int a=b+c; return b==6&&a==5; //I find the && hard to see.  2. Lots of spaces.  int a = b + c; return b == 6 && a == 5;  I find it hard to ignore the extra whitespace; it takes me longer to read it. [formatter] Separate white space preferences for separate operators enhancement Core JDT

description: The JREContainer caches classpath entries per VM. However, the classpath entries are now different when the JRE is referenced via an execution environment.   I saw a case where there were no access rules for a JRE referenced as an EE because its classpath entries were already computed as a raw JRE for another project.
my_mothod: The JREContainer caches classpath entries per VM. However, the classpath entries are now different when the JRE is referenced via an execution environment.   I saw a case where there were no access rules for a JRE referenced as an EE because its classpath entries were already computed as a raw JRE for another project. [jres] JRE container classpath entries not computed properly per project critical Debug JDT

description: The Code Formatter currently has an option for "Blank lines within class declarations, Before first declaration" but it has no option for "After last declaration."  Consider the following code:  public class A {     public void f() {     } }   The Code Formatter can add a blank line before the method, but it cannot add one after the method.  This is the intended result:  public class A {      public void f() {     }  }   This is the actual result:  public class A {      public void f() {     } }   This is an enhancement request to add a new option within the "Blank lines within class declarations" section for "After last declaration" or equivalently "Before closing brace."
my_mothod: The Code Formatter currently has an option for "Blank lines within class declarations, Before first declaration" but it has no option for "After last declaration."  Consider the following code:  public class A {     public void f() {     } }   The Code Formatter can add a blank line before the method, but it cannot add one after the method.  This is the intended result:  public class A {      public void f() {     }  }   This is the actual result:  public class A {      public void f() {     } }   This is an enhancement request to add a new option within the "Blank lines within class declarations" section for "After last declaration" or equivalently "Before closing brace." [formatter] Code formatter: blank lines after last declaration enhancement Core JDT

description: Since the Grid widget supports the single selection style when in row selection mode, it would make sense for it to also be supported when cell selection mode.
my_mothod: Since the Grid widget supports the single selection style when in row selection mode, it would make sense for it to also be supported when cell selection mode. Support single selection when cell selection is enabled. enhancement Grid Nebula

description: (3.2.1) M20070112-1200  Holding down the step over key or pressing the step over key sometimes results in the step over actions becoming disabled. This seems to happen when a variable is selected in the variables view that is showing a toString() as details that requires an evaluation. I believe the step action updates to "disabled" since the thread is performing an evaluation at the time the enablement is determined.  (This has been addressed in 3.3)
my_mothod: (3.2.1) M20070112-1200  Holding down the step over key or pressing the step over key sometimes results in the step over actions becoming disabled. I believe the step action updates to "disabled" since the thread is performing an evaluation at the time the enablement is determined. description: Build ID: I20061214-1445  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Eclipse 3.3M4 + UML2.1M4 2. File | New => Examples>UML Profile Diagram 3. In UML Profile Diagram, create a stereotype    with an attribute property. 4. Save.  case1: ProfileD with properties view  1. Window | Show View | Other... => Properties 2. ProfileD => select the stereotype property 3. Properties view => scroll to the "Type" entry. 4. Click on the "Value" column of the "Type" property. 5. THe drop-down list shows entries like this:  <<eDataType>> <Primitive Type> String <<eDataType>> <Primitive Type> String ...  case 2: org.eclipse.uml2.uml.editor with property view.  1. open the *.uml file of the *.umlprofile_diagram above. 1. Window | Show View | Other... => Properties 2. Scroll to the "Type" property of the class attribute. 3. Click on the "Value" field of that property. The drop-down list includes these entries: ecore::EENum Ecore::EENum ecore::EString ecore::String uml::String UMLPrimitiveTypes::String  Suggestions:  1) A "pathmap/prefix" view listing all of the namespaces.  This would help disambiguate the possible confusion between ecore::EString vs. Ecore::EString for example.  2) A tree-like ui widget for editing  the values available for certain property entries used in both EMF, UML2 and UML2Tools using the ExtendedPropertySheetPage of org.eclipse.emf.edit.ui.view  For example, define alternative extensions of PropertySheetSorter from org.eclipse.ui.views.properties or perhaps of the ExtendedPropertySheetPage to  present the available options in terms of a tree instead of a linear list.  One extension might organize the tree by grouping entries by common namespace prefix / pathmap alias. Another extension might organize the tree by grouping entries according to the last "name" and if multiple namespaces have distinct entries with the same name, then the children nodes of that name would show the different namespaces/prefixes/pathmap aliases where they come from.  More information: http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=151&group=eclipse.modeling.mdt.uml2#151

description: Currently there is no way to configure the transaction validator associated with a transactional editing domain.  In the TransactionalEditingDomainImpl, the validator defaults to using a live validator to validate the transaction.  If the user wishes to configure that validator (perhaps to set filters or report successes), they have no mechanism to do so.  TransactionalEditingDomain should provide a mechanism to configure its transaction validator.
my_mothod: Currently there is no way to configure the transaction validator associated with a transactional editing domain.  In the TransactionalEditingDomainImpl, the validator defaults to using a live validator to validate the transaction.  If the user wishes to configure that validator (perhaps to set filters or report successes), they have no mechanism to do so.  TransactionalEditingDomain should provide a mechanism to configure its transaction validator. TransactionalEditingDomain's TransactionValidator should be configurable enhancement Transaction EMF Services

description: It would be useful if a validator could be configured using a constraints filter.  When running validation, the validator would ensure that it only runs constraints that are accepted by the filter.  EMFT validation already provides the FilteredCollection.Filter class which is used for filtering constraints (specifically in the batch validator).  An addConstraintsFilter method could be added to IValidator which accepts a FilteredCollection.Filter.
my_mothod: It would be useful if a validator could be configured using a constraints filter.  When running validation, the validator would ensure that it only runs constraints that are accepted by the filter.  EMFT validation already provides the FilteredCollection.Filter class which is used for filtering constraints (specifically in the batch validator).  An addConstraintsFilter method could be added to IValidator which accepts a FilteredCollection.Filter. IValidator should provide mechanism to filter constraints enhancement Validation EMF Services

description: Currently the constraint preference page is internal and there is no way for clients to reuse its code.  At a minimum, clients should have access to some of the functionality of the preference page.  Ideally, the preference page could be refactored to expose certain public API which would allow clients to create their own preference page that contains a subset of constraints and/or constraint categories.
my_mothod: Currently the constraint preference page is internal and there is no way for clients to reuse its code.  At a minimum, clients should have access to some of the functionality of the preference page.  Ideally, the preference page could be refactored to expose certain public API which would allow clients to create their own preference page that contains a subset of constraints and/or constraint categories. Constraints Preference Page is not extensible enhancement Validation EMF Services

description: When live validation validates notifications, the event type of the notification is compared against a list of predefined types in EMFTEventTypes.  If the event type is not in EMFTEventTypes, the notification is not validated.  There are cases where clients wish to define their own event types for their own custom notifications.  An example might be "Add to container" and "Delete from container" events.  The client can derive these custom notifications from the raw EMF-defined notifications, and in doing so would make it easier to target containment changes without having to specify all possible containers (which could be many).
my_mothod: When live validation validates notifications, the event type of the notification is compared against a list of predefined types in EMFTEventTypes.  If the event type is not in EMFTEventTypes, the notification is not validated.  There are cases where clients wish to define their own event types for their own custom notifications.  An example might be "Add to container" and "Delete from container" events.  The client can derive these custom notifications from the raw EMF-defined notifications, and in doing so would make it easier to target containment changes without having to specify all possible containers (which could be many). Provide a mechanism to contribute new event types enhancement Validation EMF Services

description: The default behaviour in LiveValidator when determining if a notification should be validated is to exclude notifications whose notifier is not attached to a resource.  There are cases where these notifications need to be validated.  ILiveValidator should provide a mechanism to attach a notification filter.  This will allow the customization of which notifications will be accepted by the validator.  The current behaviour will remain if no notification filter is set on the validator.
my_mothod: The default behaviour in LiveValidator when determining if a notification should be validated is to exclude notifications whose notifier is not attached to a resource.  There are cases where these notifications need to be validated.  ILiveValidator should provide a mechanism to attach a notification filter.  This will allow the customization of which notifications will be accepted by the validator.  The current behaviour will remain if no notification filter is set on the validator. LiveValidator filters out notifications from notifiers who are not attached to a resource enhancement Validation EMF Services

description: The constraint descriptor associated with a constraint allows the definition of whether a constraint is enabled or disabled.  Disabled constraints are not run during validation.  The enablement of a constraint can be set programmatically, or the user has the ability to configure the enabled constraints through the EMFT validation preference page.  After a user has disabled a previously enabled constraint, all validation markers associated with that constraint should disappear.  Unfortunately there is currently no way to listen to changes in constraint enablement.
my_mothod: The constraint descriptor associated with a constraint allows the definition of whether a constraint is enabled or disabled.  Disabled constraints are not run during validation.  The enablement of a constraint can be set programmatically, or the user has the ability to configure the enabled constraints through the EMFT validation preference page.  After a user has disabled a previously enabled constraint, all validation markers associated with that constraint should disappear.  Unfortunately there is currently no way to listen to changes in constraint enablement. Add listener API for enablement changes in constraints enhancement Validation EMF Services

The field for the file in the workspace can not be edited using the keyboard. It is marked as read-only during its creation. Maybe there is a good reason for that, but I have created a patch that fix the problem and it seems to work properly. I was unable to write a meaningful test for the changed functionality. description: Some applications need to inform the user of events in the workbench that may require attention, whether or not the workbench is visible.  An increasingly standard way of doing this is to use a desktop notification popup, often appearing for a fixed amount of time in the bottom-right hand of the window.  As an example, Mylar has a custom notification mechanism to inform the user when a Bugzilla report has a new comment.  Ideally this mechanism would use the native platform mechanism for notifications.  But as far as I know the common case is that this isn't available (for Linux/GTK see http://www.galago-project.org/specs/notification/index.php).  I don't think that we should wait on native ones to become reusable because we already have the case where multiple Eclipse-based applications are showing custom notifications with different look-and-feel (e.g. the IBM Jazz demo at EclipseCon 2007 showed custom notifications that would clash with Mylar's).  To avoid these UI clashes and having other plug-ins implement their own support, it would be helpful to have Platform/UI provide an SWT-based implementation.  UI stuff to figure out: * Appearance: slide in from bottom (MSN Messenger), slide in from left (Jazz), fade in/out (Outlook 2007).  I find the latter best because it is noticeable but not distracting.   * Multiple notifications: tile or show next/prev button (Messenger, Jazz demo at EclipseCon), show sequentially (Outlook 2007), merge into 1 and elide (Mylar, Outlook 2007 in some cases).  I find tiling problematic because it's hard and stressful to aim for popups when more than one is present.  The next/prev button can be stressful to interact with because it is hard to aim for small buttons in the limited time that the notification is visible (even though the popups typically stick when mouse is over them).  For this reason on Mylar we will show up to 3 notification in a single window and provide an "n more..." hyperlink. * How much information to show.  I think less is best because the notifications are necessarily small which makes them hard to interact with, so the view or editor that they take you to should make the incoming information clear.  The notifications should present the minimal amount information for the user to decide whether they want to handle the interruption.  In conjunction I think that we should come up with a first pass at UI guidelines describing when to use which kind of notification mechanism (status line vs. system tray vs. desktop notification).  Microsoft has a similar guideline, but it's a bit thin on when to use the desktop notification mechanism.  See http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/UxGuide/UXGuide/Controls/Notifications/Notifications.asp
